channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10108] Index#getIndexTableName() returns db.index_table_name
item.description:
Index#getIndexTableName() used to just returns index table name. Now it returns a qualified table name. This change was introduced in HIVE-3781.

As a result:

IMetaStoreClient#getTable(index.getDbName(), index.getIndexTableName())

throws ObjectNotFoundException.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12708531 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

The patch (1) fixed Index#getIndexTableName() to return just the index_table_name without the database info, (2) prevents creating an index in a database different from the base table since it is not fully supported, for example, there is a problem HIVE-10109.

The patch looks good to me. My only concert is that, since now getIndexTableName() is changed back to return only index_table_name, it might affect some existing applications which rely on it to return db_name + index_table_name. Would like to hear opinions from navis, thejas, and xuefuz on this.
Chatted with Xuefu, Chao. We think it's ok to change it since this is to fix an incompatible change. Most applications should be relying on index_table_name only.
Integrated into trunk. Thanks Chao for the review, Xuefu for the discussion.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.
